Vital Force Depleted by Cold Food 

                                         (1905) M.H. 305 
     165. Food should not be eaten very hot or very cold. If food is cold, the vital force of the stomach is drawn upon in order to warm it before digestion can take place. Cold drinks are injurious for the same reason; while the free use of hot drinks is debilitating. 
     [VITALITY DRAWN UPON IN WARMING MUCH COLD FOOD IN STOMACH --124]
